NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Osteonecrosis.
body_text.section: Other Term(s) Used ::: Necrosis, bone (N) Ear, middle ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Osteocytes of the tympanic bulla.
body_text.section: Pathogenesis/cell of origin ::: Necrosis, bone (N) Ear, middle ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Nuclei in the lacuna of the bones of the tympanic bulla are absent.
body_text.section: Diagnostic Features ::: Necrosis, bone (N) Ear, middle ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: None.
body_text.section: Differential Diagnoses ::: Necrosis, bone (N) Ear, middle ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Severe irritants instilled into the external ear canal or into the middle ear
can produce necrosis of the bone.
body_text.section: Comment ::: Necrosis, bone (N) Ear, middle ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Mouse; Rat.
body_text.section: Species ::: Necrosis, tympanic membrane (N) Ear, middle ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Coagulative necrosis.
body_text.section: Other Term(s) Used ::: Necrosis, tympanic membrane (N) Ear, middle ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: All layers of the tympanic membrane.
body_text.section: Pathogenesis/cell of origin ::: Necrosis, tympanic membrane (N) Ear, middle ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: None.
body_text.section: Differential Diagnoses ::: Necrosis, tympanic membrane (N) Ear, middle ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Severe irritants instilled into the external ear canal or into the middle ear
can produce necrosis of the tympanic membrane. Necrosis is often accompanied
by inflammation.
body_text.section: Comment ::: Necrosis, tympanic membrane (N) Ear, middle ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Mouse; Rat.
body_text.section: Species ::: Infiltrate, inflammatory cell (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Leukocytes recruited from the systemic circulation. The pathogenesis is
uncertain, but presumably a self-limiting response designed for immune
surveillance and minor tissue repair activities.
body_text.section: Pathogenesis/cell of origin ::: Infiltrate, inflammatory cell (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Foci of single inflammatory cell type or a mixture of different cell
types without other features of inflammation.Infiltrates may be neutrophil, macrophage, foamy macrophage,
mononuclear cell, or mixed cell populations.
body_text.section: Diagnostic Features ::: Infiltrate, inflammatory cell (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Inflammation:
body_text.section: Differential Diagnoses ::: Infiltrate, inflammatory cell (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Inflammatory cellular infiltrate with possible edema, congestion,
hemorrhage, and/or necrosis.
body_text.section: Differential Diagnoses ::: Infiltrate, inflammatory cell (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
‘Infiltrate’ is the preferred term, followed by the predominant cell type
(neutrophilic, eosinophilic, lymphocytic, plasmacytic, histiocytic, or foamy
macrophages) or mixture of different cell types (mixed). Infiltrates resolve
without residual damage to the otic tissues. Foamy macrophages in small
numbers may be observed as a spontaneous background change in the tympanic
bulla lumen, but will be increased in number and more prominent with
transtympanically injected drug and/or vehicle.
body_text.section: Comment ::: Infiltrate, inflammatory cell (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Mouse; Rat.
body_text.section: Species ::: Inflammation, middle ear (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Otitis media.
body_text.section: Other Term(s) Used ::: Inflammation, middle ear (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
The inflammation affects the mucosa lining the tympanic bulla. Neutrophils,
lymphocytes, and/or macrophages infiltrate into tissues or spaces in response
to an irritant or infectious process.
body_text.section: Pathogenesis/cell of origin ::: Inflammation, middle ear (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
The propria of the mucosa of the tympanic bulla is expanded by edema
and/or infiltrating inflammatory cells.Migration of inflammatory cells into the bulla lumen may occur.
body_text.section: Diagnostic Features ::: Inflammation, middle ear (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: None.
body_text.section: Differential Diagnoses ::: Inflammation, middle ear (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
May have necrosis of associated tissues. Inflammation of the middle ear may
be induced by instillation of irritating substances, but also occur
spontaneously (Verdaguer et
al. 2006). Inflammation in the middle ear is often due to a breach or
compromise in the natural barriers of the middle ear, although spontaneous
infections are relatively frequent. The specific location within the middle
ear should be designated with anatomic locators whenever possible (e.g.,
tympanic membrane, ossicles, round window niche, etc.).
body_text.section: Comment ::: Inflammation, middle ear (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Mouse; Rat.
body_text.section: Species ::: Inflammation, middle ear, catarrhal (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Otitis media, catarrhal; mucous hyperplasia/metaplasia.
body_text.section: Other Term(s) Used ::: Inflammation, middle ear, catarrhal (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Mucus production by the epithelium lining the tympanic bulla.
body_text.section: Pathogenesis/cell of origin ::: Inflammation, middle ear, catarrhal (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Accumulation of relatively cell-free fluid and mucous material is
present in the tympanic bulla space.
body_text.section: Diagnostic Features ::: Inflammation, middle ear, catarrhal (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Edema
body_text.section: Differential Diagnoses ::: Inflammation, middle ear, catarrhal (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Inflammation, middle ear
body_text.section: Differential Diagnoses ::: Inflammation, middle ear, catarrhal (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Catarrhal inflammation is usually accompanied by metaplasia of the epithelium
of the tympanic bulla to include numerous goblet cells. Low numbers of
exfoliated epithelial cells may be part of the alteration (Schafer and Bolon
2013).
body_text.section: Comment ::: Inflammation, middle ear, catarrhal (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Mouse; Rat.
body_text.section: Species ::: Metaplasia, squamous cell (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Epithelial hyperplasia, tympanic bulla mucosa.
body_text.section: Other Term(s) Used ::: Metaplasia, squamous cell (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Epithelium lining the tympanic bulla.
body_text.section: Pathogenesis/cell of origin ::: Metaplasia, squamous cell (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
The epithelium lining the tympanic bulla has a stratified squamous
morphology.The epithelium may or may not be keratinizing.
body_text.section: Diagnostic Features ::: Metaplasia, squamous cell (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: None.
body_text.section: Differential Diagnoses ::: Metaplasia, squamous cell (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
The epithelium lining the tympanic bulla is a simple squamous epithelium in
most areas with simple cuboidal to simple columnar epithelium in the most
dependent areas (ventral). The epithelium can undergo squamous metaplasia as
an adaptive, protective change in response to an irritant or infectious
process and may be associated with inflammation.
body_text.section: Comment ::: Metaplasia, squamous cell (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Mouse; Rat.
body_text.section: Species ::: Metaplasia, tall cuboidal to columnar (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Epithelium lining the tympanic bulla.
body_text.section: Pathogenesis/cell of origin ::: Metaplasia, tall cuboidal to columnar (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
The epithelium lining the tympanic bulla consists of tall cuboidal to
columnar cells.May include numerous goblet cells.
body_text.section: Diagnostic Features ::: Metaplasia, tall cuboidal to columnar (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: None.
body_text.section: Differential Diagnoses ::: Metaplasia, tall cuboidal to columnar (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
The epithelium lining the tympanic bulla is normally a simple squamous
epithelium in most areas with simple cuboidal to simple columnar epithelium in
the most dependent areas (ventral). Alterations may be induced by a mild
irritant in the inner ear, e.g. slightly acidic solutions. The epithelium can
undergo cuboidal or columnar metaplasia as an adaptive, protective change in
response to an irritant or infectious process and may be associated with
inflammation. The most ventral aspect of the tympanic bulla will often have
cuboidal to columnar epithelium normally.
body_text.section: Comment ::: Metaplasia, tall cuboidal to columnar (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Mouse; Rat.
body_text.section: Species ::: Fibrosis (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Proliferation of fibroblasts and deposition of loose connective tissue in the
propria of the mucosa of the tympanic bulla.
body_text.section: Pathogenesis/cell of origin ::: Fibrosis (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
The tympanic bulla propria is expanded by loose connective tissue with
minimal collagen production.
body_text.section: Diagnostic Features ::: Fibrosis (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Edema
body_text.section: Differential Diagnoses ::: Fibrosis (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Fibrosis is usually accompanied by inflammation and represents a protective
mechanism.
body_text.section: Comment ::: Fibrosis (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Mouse; Rat.
body_text.section: Species ::: Granulation tissue (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Proliferation of fibroblasts and deposition of loose connective tissue in the
propria of the mucosa of the tympanic bulla in combination with edema,
vascular proliferation, and sometimes new bone formation. The mucosa of the
typamic bulla may be expanded by pseudoglands.
body_text.section: Pathogenesis/cell of origin ::: Granulation tissue (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
The tympanic bulla propria is expanded by loose connective tissue with
minimal collagen production, edema, and vascular proliferation.
body_text.section: Diagnostic Features ::: Granulation tissue (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Edema, Fibrosis
body_text.section: Differential Diagnoses ::: Granulation tissue (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Granulation tissue is usually accompanied by inflammation and represents a
protective mechanism, often in reaction to a chronic irritant in the middle
ear.
body_text.section: Comment ::: Granulation tissue (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Mouse; Rat.
body_text.section: Species ::: Inflammation, granulomatous (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Reaction of mucosa to foreign material in the tympanic bulla.
body_text.section: Pathogenesis/cell of origin ::: Inflammation, granulomatous (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Infiltrates consist of epithelioid macrophages, multinucleated giant
cells and lymphocytes.May have abundant necrotic cells and debris and neutrophils.May fill large portions of the tympanic bulla.
body_text.section: Diagnostic Features ::: Inflammation, granulomatous (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Inflammation, middle ear
body_text.section: Differential Diagnoses ::: Inflammation, granulomatous (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Cholesteatoma
body_text.section: Differential Diagnoses ::: Inflammation, granulomatous (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Often occurs as a response to foreign body gaining entry via a ruptured
tympanic membrane or as a reaction against materials administered via a
cannula. Inert material may result in accumulation of foamy macrophages.
body_text.section: Comment ::: Inflammation, granulomatous (N) Ear, middle ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Mouse; Rat.
body_text.section: Species ::: Hemorrhage (N) Ear, middle ::: Vascular Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Ulceration or necrosis of the mucosa may expose the underlying propria and
result in bleeding into the lumen. Rupture of the tympanic membrane may
disrupt the vessels of the membrane and produce hemorrhage as well. Severe
irritants may produce hemorrhage of the propria of the tympanic bulla.
body_text.section: Pathogenesis/cell of origin ::: Hemorrhage (N) Ear, middle ::: Vascular Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Blood is present in the tympanic bulla space or in the propria of the
tympanic bulla.Secondary changes of pigment deposition, fibroplasia etc. may be
present.
body_text.section: Diagnostic Features ::: Hemorrhage (N) Ear, middle ::: Vascular Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: None.
body_text.section: Differential Diagnoses ::: Hemorrhage (N) Ear, middle ::: Vascular Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Mouse; Rat.
body_text.section:
Species ::: Edema (N) (Figure 123fig_123fig) Ear,
middle ::: Vascular Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Leakage of fluid into the propria.
body_text.section:
Pathogenesis/cell of origin ::: Edema (N) (Figure 123fig_123fig) Ear,
middle ::: Vascular Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: The propria of the middle ear is expanded by pale staining fluid.
body_text.section:
Diagnostic Features ::: Edema (N) (Figure 123fig_123fig) Ear,
middle ::: Vascular Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Hemorrhage
body_text.section:
Differential Diagnoses ::: Edema (N) (Figure 123fig_123fig) Ear,
middle ::: Vascular Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Edema is usually accompanied by epithelial and inflammatory changes. It may
occur with administration of saline alone.
body_text.section:
Comment ::: Edema (N) (Figure 123fig_123fig) Ear,
middle ::: Vascular Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Mouse; Rat.
body_text.section: Species ::: Cyst (N) Ear, middle ::: Miscellaneous Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Epithelium lining the tympanic bulla.
body_text.section: Pathogenesis/cell of origin ::: Cyst (N) Ear, middle ::: Miscellaneous Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
The epithelium forms cystic structures.Cysts contain nonstaining fluid or mucoid material and cell debris.Cysts most likely occur in the ventral aspects of the tympanic
bulla.
body_text.section: Diagnostic Features ::: Cyst (N) Ear, middle ::: Miscellaneous Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Cholesteatoma
body_text.section: Differential Diagnoses ::: Cyst (N) Ear, middle ::: Miscellaneous Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: None.
body_text.section: Comment ::: Cyst (N) Ear, middle ::: Miscellaneous Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Mouse; Rat.
body_text.section: Species ::: Cholesteatoma (N) Ear, middle ::: Miscellaneous Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
The tympanic membrane squamous epithelium forms an expansive mass. It may be
the result of a trauma.
body_text.section: Pathogenesis/cell of origin ::: Cholesteatoma (N) Ear, middle ::: Miscellaneous Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
A squamous cyst is present in the tympanic bulla.May contain cholesterol clefts from the degenerating cell membranes or
previous hemorrhage.May be associated with granulomatous inflammation.
body_text.section: Diagnostic Features ::: Cholesteatoma (N) Ear, middle ::: Miscellaneous Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Tympanic membrane Cyst
body_text.section: Differential Diagnoses ::: Cholesteatoma (N) Ear, middle ::: Miscellaneous Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Cholesteatomas occur on the medial side of the tympanic membrane. They may be
pedunculated or occur as a polyplike structure, and may progressively enlarge
with time. Cholesteatomas can be induced by irritants or surgical ligation of
the external ear canal (Hottendorf
1991; McGinn et al.
1982, Steinbach and Grüninger 1980).
body_text.section: Comment ::: Cholesteatoma (N) Ear, middle ::: Miscellaneous Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Mouse; Rat.
body_text.section: Species ::: Atrophy, bone (N) Ear, middle ::: Miscellaneous Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Tympanic bulla or middle ear ossicles.
body_text.section: Sublocation ::: Atrophy, bone (N) Ear, middle ::: Miscellaneous Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Osteopenia.
body_text.section: Other Term(s) Used ::: Atrophy, bone (N) Ear, middle ::: Miscellaneous Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Osteoclasts.
body_text.section: Pathogenesis/cell of origin ::: Atrophy, bone (N) Ear, middle ::: Miscellaneous Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
The tympanic bulla or middle ear ossicles have scalloping of margins
and thinning of the bone.
body_text.section: Diagnostic Features ::: Atrophy, bone (N) Ear, middle ::: Miscellaneous Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: None.
body_text.section: Differential Diagnoses ::: Atrophy, bone (N) Ear, middle ::: Miscellaneous Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
The atrophy of the bone may be the consequence of an inflammatory process
that encapsulates the ossicles as a reaction to a nonspecific irritant.
body_text.section: Comment ::: Atrophy, bone (N) Ear, middle ::: Miscellaneous Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Mouse; Rat.
body_text.section: Species ::: New bone formation (N) Ear, middle ::: Miscellaneous Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Hyperostosis; Osteosclerosis.
body_text.section: Other Term(s) Used ::: New bone formation (N) Ear, middle ::: Miscellaneous Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Osteoblasts.
body_text.section: Pathogenesis/cell of origin ::: New bone formation (N) Ear, middle ::: Miscellaneous Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
The tympanic bulla is thickened, often with a prominent “watermark”
delineating the newly deposited woven bone.In some instances, there may be sharp spicules of new bone formation
that extends into exudates in the tympanic bulla.
body_text.section: Diagnostic Features ::: New bone formation (N) Ear, middle ::: Miscellaneous Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: None.
body_text.section: Differential Diagnoses ::: New bone formation (N) Ear, middle ::: Miscellaneous Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
The new bone formation is usually the consequence of an irritant that induces
a chronic-active inflammatory process that results in persistent exudate in
the tympanic bulla.
body_text.section: Comment ::: New bone formation (N) Ear, middle ::: Miscellaneous Changes ::: Middle Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Mouse; Rat.
body_text.section:

inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Crista ampullaris.
body_text.section:
Sublocation ::: Degeneration, hair cells and/or epithelium (N) Ear,
inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Decreased number, hair cell
body_text.section:
Synonym ::: Degeneration, hair cells and/or epithelium (N) Ear,
inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Hair cells of crista ampullaris.
body_text.section:
Pathogenesis/cell of origin ::: Degeneration, hair cells and/or epithelium (N) Ear,
inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: The surface epithelium is disorganized and may show vacuolation.Pyknotic debris may be visible within the epithelium.
body_text.section:
Diagnostic Features ::: Degeneration, hair cells and/or epithelium (N) Ear,
inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Hair cell necrosis
body_text.section:
Differential Diagnoses ::: Degeneration, hair cells and/or epithelium (N) Ear,
inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Often there is evidence of both degeneration and necrosis present in the
epithelium of the crista ampullaris. Alterations may be induced by macrolide
antibiotics and other intoxicants (Ibrahim et al. 2014; Schafer & Bolon 2013).
body_text.section:
Comment ::: Degeneration, hair cells and/or epithelium (N) Ear,
inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Mouse; Rat.
body_text.section: Species ::: Decreased Number, Hair cell (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Cochlea or cristae ampullaris.
body_text.section: Sublocation ::: Decreased Number, Hair cell (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Injury to the outer or inner hair cells of the organ of Corti or cristae
ampullaris.
body_text.section: Pathogenesis/cell of origin ::: Decreased Number, Hair cell (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Hair cells are absent and replaced by large, non-descript, swollen
cells.In more chronic instances, these large cells will shrink and form a low
cuboidal layer lining the scala media where the inner and outer hair
cells should be in the organ of Corti.
body_text.section: Diagnostic Features ::: Decreased Number, Hair cell (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Hair cell necrosis
body_text.section: Differential Diagnoses ::: Decreased Number, Hair cell (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Degeneration, hair cells (cochlea or crista ampullaris)
body_text.section: Differential Diagnoses ::: Decreased Number, Hair cell (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Hair cell necrosis, depending on the insult, may occur fairly rapidly in the
course of a toxicology study such that the process of hair cell necrosis is
not observed, only the end result (hair cell loss is no longer active).
Because the hair cell necrosis appears to be an apoptotic process, there is
generally not residual inflammation present unless the test article applied to
the middle/inner ear was a severe irritant producing generalized inflammation
and necrosis of the tissues of the cochlea. (Schafer & Bolon 2013).
body_text.section: Comment ::: Decreased Number, Hair cell (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Mouse; Rat.
body_text.section: Species ::: Necrosis, Hair cell (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Cochlea or cristae ampullaris.
body_text.section: Sublocation ::: Necrosis, Hair cell (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Injury to the outer or inner hair cells of the organ of Corti or the hair
cells at the apex of the crista ampullaris.
body_text.section: Pathogenesis/cell of origin ::: Necrosis, Hair cell (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Cells are shrunken with eosinophilic cytoplasm and pyknotic,
karyorrhectic, or karyolytic nuclei (consistent with apoptosis).
body_text.section: Diagnostic Features ::: Necrosis, Hair cell (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Hair cell loss
body_text.section: Differential Diagnoses ::: Necrosis, Hair cell (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Hair cell necrosis due to specific ototoxicants (in contrast to non-specific
irritants) tends to be apoptotic necrosis. Macrolide antibiotics such as
gentamicin will produce this change (Schafer & Bolon 2013).
body_text.section: Comment ::: Necrosis, Hair cell (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Mouse; Rat.
body_text.section: Species ::: Necrosis, cartilage (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Oval window footplates.
body_text.section: Sublocation ::: Necrosis, cartilage (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Chondronecrosis.
body_text.section: Other Term(s) Used ::: Necrosis, cartilage (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Chondrocytes.
body_text.section: Pathogenesis/cell of origin ::: Necrosis, cartilage (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Nuclei in the lacuna of the cartilage of the footplates of the stapes
and the corresponding rim of the oval window are absent.
body_text.section: Diagnostic Features ::: Necrosis, cartilage (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: None.
body_text.section: Differential Diagnoses ::: Necrosis, cartilage (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Severe irritants instilled into the middle ear can produce necrosis of the
cartilage of the stapes and round window.
body_text.section: Comment ::: Necrosis, cartilage (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Mouse; Rat.
body_text.section: Species ::: Necrosis, vestibular organ (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Vestibular organ hair cells/epithelium or entire organ.
body_text.section: Pathogenesis/cell of origin ::: Necrosis, vestibular organ (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
With specific ototoxicants, there may be shrunken, eosinophilic
epithelial cells with pyknotic, karyorrhectic, karyolytic nuclei.With nonspecific irritants, there may be coagulative necrosis of all
cells of the vestibular organ.
body_text.section: Diagnostic Features ::: Necrosis, vestibular organ (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Degeneration of vestibular organ
body_text.section: Differential Diagnoses ::: Necrosis, vestibular organ (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Mouse; Rat.
body_text.section: Species ::: Necrosis, neuronal (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Neuronal cell bodies of spiral or vestibular ganglion.
body_text.section: Pathogenesis/cell of origin ::: Necrosis, neuronal (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
The neurons of the ganglia are shrunken and with hypereosinophilic
cytoplasm.
body_text.section: Diagnostic Features ::: Necrosis, neuronal (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Dark neuron artifact
body_text.section: Differential Diagnoses ::: Necrosis, neuronal (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
With sufficient time, a dying back process due to loss of hair cells of the
organ of Corti, the crista ampullaris, or the vestibular organ will result in
loss of connections and loss of neurons. Due to the normal variability of
density of ganglion cells in the spiral ganglion, it is difficult to diagnose
loss of ganglion cells without observation of active necrosis. Further details
can be found in proliferative and nonproliferative lesions of the rat and
mouse central and peripheral nervous system (Kaufmann et al. 2012, see
Introduction).
body_text.section: Comment ::: Necrosis, neuronal (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Mouse; Rat.
body_text.section:
Species ::: Degeneration, axonal, vestibulo-cochlear nerve (N) Ear,
inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Vestibular nerve, cochlear nerve, or vestibulocochlear nerve (CN VIII).
body_text.section:
Pathogenesis/cell of origin ::: Degeneration, axonal, vestibulo-cochlear nerve (N) Ear,
inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Early stage lesions include axonal swelling and eosinophilia.Late stage lesions include axonal fragmentation and formation of
digestion chambers within the nerve.
body_text.section:
Diagnostic Features ::: Degeneration, axonal, vestibulo-cochlear nerve (N) Ear,
inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: None.
body_text.section:
Differential Diagnoses ::: Degeneration, axonal, vestibulo-cochlear nerve (N) Ear,
inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
With sufficient time, a dying back process due to loss of hair cells of the
organ of Corti, the crista ampullaris, or the vestibular organ will result in
loss of connections and loss of neurons and subsequent loss of axons that
extend to the brain. Further details can be found in proliferative and
nonproliferative lesions of the rat and mouse central and peripheral nervous
system (Kaufmann et al.
2012, see Introduction).
body_text.section:
Comment ::: Degeneration, axonal, vestibulo-cochlear nerve (N) Ear,
inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Mouse; Rat.
body_text.section:
Species ::: Decreased cellularity, spiral limbus, spiral ligament, and/or stria
vascularis (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Fibrocytes of the spiral limbus, fibrocytes of the spiral ligament,
epithelial cells of the stria vascularis.
body_text.section:
Pathogenesis/cell of origin ::: Decreased cellularity, spiral limbus, spiral ligament, and/or stria
vascularis (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: The cell density is decreased when compared to concurrent controls.
body_text.section:
Diagnostic Features ::: Decreased cellularity, spiral limbus, spiral ligament, and/or stria
vascularis (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Necrosis, neuronal
body_text.section:
Differential Diagnoses ::: Decreased cellularity, spiral limbus, spiral ligament, and/or stria
vascularis (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Loss of cellularity of the spiral limbus will often follow hair cell loss,
presumably by a feedback mechanism, although of currently unknown mechanism.
The loss of cells of the spiral ligament may be a specific toxicity or may be
a consequence of injury to the overlying stria vascularis. The stria
vascularis may be injured by various toxicants and have loss of cells of the
inner, intermediate, or outer layers (Schafer and Bolon 2013).
body_text.section:
Comment ::: Decreased cellularity, spiral limbus, spiral ligament, and/or stria
vascularis (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Mouse; Rat.
body_text.section: Species ::: Decreased cellularity, spiral ganglion (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Ganglion cells, spiral ganglion.
body_text.section: Pathogenesis/cell of origin ::: Decreased cellularity, spiral ganglion (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: The cell density is decreased when compared to concurrent controls.
body_text.section: Diagnostic Features ::: Decreased cellularity, spiral ganglion (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Necrosis, neuronal
body_text.section: Differential Diagnoses ::: Decreased cellularity, spiral ganglion (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Loss of cellularity of the spiral ganglion should be made with extreme
caution. The spiral ganglion has wide variability in cellular density from the
apex to the base. This variability makes identification of cell loss difficult
in the absence of other markers of change (ganglion cell necrosis or axonal
degeneration of the cochlear nerve. Careful comparison of the same areas of
the spiral ganglion between controls and treated animals need to be done to
make this diagnosis (Schafer and Bolon 2013).
body_text.section: Comment ::: Decreased cellularity, spiral ganglion (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Mouse; Rat.
body_text.section: Species ::: Vacuolation, hair cell/supporting cell (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Hair cell or supporting cell injury in the organ of Corti.
body_text.section: Pathogenesis/cell of origin ::: Vacuolation, hair cell/supporting cell (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Hair cells or supporting cells are vacuolated.Loss of hair cells with replacement by supporting cells may have
pallor, hydropic change, or vacuolation of the supporting cells.
body_text.section: Diagnostic Features ::: Vacuolation, hair cell/supporting cell (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Hair cell necrosis
body_text.section: Differential Diagnoses ::: Vacuolation, hair cell/supporting cell (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Hair cell loss
body_text.section: Differential Diagnoses ::: Vacuolation, hair cell/supporting cell (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Degeneration, hair cells
body_text.section: Differential Diagnoses ::: Vacuolation, hair cell/supporting cell (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Histologic processing will often produce an artifactual vacuolation of the
supporting cells of the organ of Corti, including cells of Hensen, cells of
Boettcher, and others that must be distinguished from a toxic insult (Schafer and Bolon
2013).
body_text.section: Comment ::: Vacuolation, hair cell/supporting cell (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Mouse; Rat.
body_text.section: Species ::: Vacuolation, stria vascularis (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Epithelial cells of the stria vascularis.
body_text.section: Pathogenesis/cell of origin ::: Vacuolation, stria vascularis (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Swelling and vacuolation is present in individual cells of the stria
vascularis.
body_text.section: Diagnostic Features ::: Vacuolation, stria vascularis (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: None.
body_text.section: Differential Diagnoses ::: Vacuolation, stria vascularis (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Injury to the stria vascularis, which is critical in maintaining an
electropotential across the inner ear, will often manifest by swelling. This
may be intracellular (hydropic change) or extracellular (edema) (Schafer and Bolon
2013).
body_text.section: Comment ::: Vacuolation, stria vascularis (N) Ear, inner ::: Degenerative Changes ::: Inner Ear ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Mouse; Rat.
body_text.section: Species ::: Inflammation, inner ear (N) Ear, inner ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Otitis interna.
body_text.section: Other Term(s) Used ::: Inflammation, inner ear (N) Ear, inner ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Infiltrates of inflammatory cells are present in various spaces of the inner
ear. This may be accompanied by readily apparent proteinaceous exudates, or the
exudate may be the sole change.
body_text.section: Pathogenesis/cell of origin ::: Inflammation, inner ear (N) Ear, inner ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Inflammatory cells (often neutrophils, but may include macrophages, giant
cells, and lymphocytes) accumulate in the fluid spaces of the scala
vestibuli, scala tympani, and/or scala media or within the soft tissues
lining the cochlea (spiral ligament, stria vascularis, etc).
body_text.section: Diagnostic Features ::: Inflammation, inner ear (N) Ear, inner ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Serous exudation
body_text.section: Differential Diagnoses ::: Inflammation, inner ear (N) Ear, inner ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Suppurative inflammation
body_text.section: Differential Diagnoses ::: Inflammation, inner ear (N) Ear, inner ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Pyogranulomatous inflammation
body_text.section: Differential Diagnoses ::: Inflammation, inner ear (N) Ear, inner ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Granulomatous inflammation
body_text.section: Differential Diagnoses ::: Inflammation, inner ear (N) Ear, inner ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Infiltrates of inflammatory cells are usually a reflection of injury by a
nonspecific irritant. The inflammation can secondarily injure important
structural components of the inner ear such as the hair cells and stria
vascularis. The inflammation could potentially be due to infectious agents,
which need to be distinguished from an injury by a toxic insult.
body_text.section: Comment ::: Inflammation, inner ear (N) Ear, inner ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Mouse; Rat.
body_text.section: Species ::: Fibrosis (N) Ear, inner ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Round window, scala vestibuli, scala media, and/or scala tympani.
body_text.section: Sublocation ::: Fibrosis (N) Ear, inner ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Fibroblasts of the membranes.
body_text.section: Pathogenesis/cell of origin ::: Fibrosis (N) Ear, inner ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: None.
body_text.section: Differential Diagnoses ::: Fibrosis (N) Ear, inner ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
The fibrosis of these membranes is usually due to nonspecific irritants; this
change would be anticipated to deaden vibrations.
body_text.section: Comment ::: Fibrosis (N) Ear, inner ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Mouse; Rat.
body_text.section:
Species ::: Otolith loss, disorganization, or disruption (N) Ear,
inner ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Vestibular organ.
body_text.section:
Sublocation ::: Otolith loss, disorganization, or disruption (N) Ear,
inner ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Otolith epithelium.
body_text.section:
Pathogenesis/cell of origin ::: Otolith loss, disorganization, or disruption (N) Ear,
inner ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Otoliths contained within the gel lining the surface of the vestibular
organ are misaligned, disrupted, or absent.
body_text.section:
Diagnostic Features ::: Otolith loss, disorganization, or disruption (N) Ear,
inner ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: None.
body_text.section:
Differential Diagnoses ::: Otolith loss, disorganization, or disruption (N) Ear,
inner ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
The loss of otoliths is likely an effect on the underlying epithelium that
maintains the gel matrix.
body_text.section:
Comment ::: Otolith loss, disorganization, or disruption (N) Ear,
inner ::: Inflammatory Changes ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Mouse; Rat.
body_text.section: Species ::: Edema (N) Ear, inner ::: Vascular Changes ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Round window membrane, scala vestibuli, scala media, and or scala tympani.
body_text.section: Sublocation ::: Edema (N) Ear, inner ::: Vascular Changes ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Injury to the lining epithelium of the various tissues.
body_text.section: Pathogenesis/cell of origin ::: Edema (N) Ear, inner ::: Vascular Changes ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
Loose expansion of the mucosa of the spaces adjacent to the otic capsule
or modiolus is present.
body_text.section: Diagnostic Features ::: Edema (N) Ear, inner ::: Vascular Changes ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text: Fibrosis
body_text.section: Differential Diagnoses ::: Edema (N) Ear, inner ::: Vascular Changes ::: Normal Anatomy (Internal Ear) ::: Nonproliferative Lesions of the Rat and Mouse Ear ::: Terminology and Descriptions ::: IV. NONPROLIFERATIVE ANDPROLIFERATIVE LESIONS OF THE RATAND MOUSE OTIC SYSTEM

body_text.text:
With an irritant, the submembranous spaces adjacent to the bone are expanded by
fluid, likely as a consequence of injury to the lining epithelium.

body_text.text:
Hemorrhage likely arises from the stria vascularis, if in the scala media, and
from the mucosa lining the wall, if in the scala tympani and/or scala
vestibuli.

body_text.text:
Blood is present within the scala vestibuli, scala tympani, and/or scala
media.
